SENT.plain: PURPOSE: An 11-year-old boy had a one-month history of horizontal diplopia
Three years earlier, he had undergone allogeneic bone marrow transplantation complicated by graft versus host disease
METHODS: The patient had esotropia and bilateral optic disk edema
A magnetic resonance imaging scan disclosed no intracranial lesion
The opening pressure of the lumbar puncture was 500 mm of water
Pseudotumor cerebri secondary to cyclosporine was diagnosed
RESULTS: The patient improved with resolution of his esotropia and diplopia within five days of discontinuing his cyclosporine
The optic disk edema resolved within three months
CONCLUSION: Cyclosporine must be added to the list of medications with a known association with pseudotumor cerebri
